info.title: Juspay - API Documentation
info.description:
## Get started

Juspay provides a collection of APIs that enable you to process and manage payments.
Our APIs accept and return JSON in the HTTP body, and return standard HTTP response codes.

You can consume the APIs directly using your favorite HTTP/REST library.

We have a testing environment referred to "sandbox", which you can setup to test API calls without
affecting production data.
Currently, our sandbox environment is live while our production environment is under development
and will be available soon.
You can sign up on our Dashboard to get API keys to access Hyperswitch API.

### Environment

Use the following base URLs when making requests to the APIs:

| Environment   |  Base URL                          |
|---------------|------------------------------------|
| Sandbox       | <https://sandbox.juspay.in>   |
| Production    | <https://api.juspay.in>       |

## Authentication

When you sign up on our [dashboard](https://app.hyperswitch.io) and create a merchant
account, you are given a secret key (also referred as api-key) and a publishable key.
You may authenticate all API requests with Hyperswitch server by providing the appropriate key in
the request Authorization header.

| Key             |  Description                                                                                  |
|-----------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| api-key         | Private key. Used to authenticate all API requests from your merchant server                  |
| publishable key | Unique identifier for your account. Used to authenticate API requests from your app's client  |

Never share your secret api keys. Keep them guarded and secure.

post.description:
Payments - Session

**Creates a payment object when amount and currency are passed.** This API is also used to create a mandate by passing the `mandate_object`.

To completely process a payment you will have to create a payment, attach a payment method, confirm and capture funds.

Depending on the user journey you wish to achieve, you may opt to complete all the steps in a single request by attaching a payment method, setting `confirm=true` and `capture_method = automatic` in the *Payments/Create API* request or you could use the following sequence of API requests to achieve the same:

1. Payments - Create

2. Payments - Update

3. Payments - Confirm

4. Payments - Capture.

Use the client secret returned in this API along with your publishable key to make subsequent API calls from your client

get.description:
Orders - Retrieve

Retrieves a Payment. This API can also be used to get the status of a previously initiated payment or next action for an ongoing payment

200.description: Gets the payment with final status

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the order

parameters.name: txn_uuid
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the txn

200.description: Cancle the payment using pre auth

parameters.name: txn_uuid
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the txn

200.description: Cancle the payment using pre auth

customer_email.description: The identifier for the Merchant Account.

customer_phone.description: Decider to enable or disable the connector call for retrieve request

customer_id.description: This is a token which expires after 15 minutes, used from the client to authenticate and create sessions from the SDK

status_id.description: If enabled provides list of captures linked to latest attempt
